com.here.android.mpa.mapping

Class SupportMapFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.SupportMapFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, com.nokia.maps.MapUi
    Deprecated. 
    As of SDK 3.13. Use AndroidXMapFragment that extends Fragment from the androidx library.

    @Deprecated
public class SupportMapFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements com.nokia.maps.MapUi
    A fragment class that automatically creates a Map and handles map UI interactions such as panning and zooming. SupportMapFragment extends the Android Fragment class and retains its lifecycle behaviors.

    Upon the initialization of SupportMapFragment, a Map object is automatically created and bound to the fragment. This Map object is then persisted throughout the SupportMapFragment's lifetime. Since SupportMapFragment internally calls Fragment.setRetainInstance(true), the Map will retain any properties applied to it during an application's lifetime.

    SupportMapFragment objects have their own lifecycle, state, and back stack, thus it is unsafe to assume objects returned by a SupportMapFragment instance (with the exception of Map) will be available throughout the lifetime of its attached activity.

    A SupportMapFragment is defined in an Android layout XML file. For example: 

     
   <fragment
       class="com.here.android.mpa.mapping.SupportMapFragment"
       android:id="@+id/map_fragment"
       android:layout_width="match_parent"
       android:layout_height="match_parent" />

    Note: SupportMapFragment automatically handles MapEngine pausing and resuming during activity state changes, thus it is not necessary for the activity that owns SupportMapFragment instances to manually call MapEngine.onPause() or MapEngine.onResume() during the activity's SupportMapFragment.onPause() and SupportMapFragment.onResume(). However, considerations should be made in how much processing is done during the onResume() method. Performing significant amounts of processing may delay view rendering in cases such as device orientation changes. In these cases, it is recommended to use a specifically designated handler to organize the amount of processing to be done.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(OnEngineInitListener listener)
        Deprecated. 
        Initializes the MapEngine and displays a map that occupies the entire SupportMapFragment's view rectangle. Users of SupportMapFragment should call this method or SupportMapFragment.init(ApplicationContext, OnEngineInitListener) after the fragment is first attached to its activity. This method should only be used for fragments declared in a layout XML. Do not use this method when SupportMapFragment is created programmatically.

        This method will initialize MapEngine with MapEngine.MapVariant.GLOBAL map variant on first SDK usage and with stored map variant on sub-sequent usages.

        Parameters:
        listener - A OnEngineInitListener object that will be called when SupportMapFragment initialization is finished. A null object can be supplied if the caller does not expect any notification when initialization completes.
        See Also:
        OnEngineInitListener, MapEngine.init(ApplicationContext, OnEngineInitListener), SupportMapFragment.init(ApplicationContext, OnEngineInitListener)

      • init

        public void init(ApplicationContext context,
                 OnEngineInitListener listener)
        Deprecated. 
        Initializes the MapEngine and displays a map that occupies the entire SupportMapFragment's view rectangle. Users of SupportMapFragment should call this method after the fragment is first attached to its activity.

        This method can be used for SupportMapFragment objects that are created programmatically or declared in a layout XML file.

        This method will initialize MapEngine with ApplicationContext to be used during initialization.

        Parameters:
        context - ApplicationContext to be used during initialization.
        listener - A OnEngineInitListener object that will be called when SupportMapFragment initialization is finished. A null object can be supplied if the caller does not require any notification when initialization completes.
        See Also:
        OnEngineInitListener, MapEngine.init(ApplicationContext, OnEngineInitListener)

      • getClipRect

        public ViewRect getClipRect()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the ViewRect representing the clip rectangle for this SupportMapFragment.
        Specified by:
        getClipRect in interface com.nokia.maps.MapUi
        Returns:
        The clip rectangle for rendering MapObject objects and similar map-related screen elements. Null if the view's layout process has yet to be completed.

        If the process is not yet complete, users can either retry later or subscribe as a OnMapRenderListener and call this method upon the callback OnMapRenderListener.onSizeChanged(int, int).

      • setClipRect

        public void setClipRect(ViewRect rect,
                        android.graphics.PointF transformCenter)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets a clipping rectangle to the SupportMapFragment. Only the area specified by the ViewRect will be used for rendering, while the rest of the view will be masked in black. This rectangle will be reset to the full size of the SupportMapFragment upon screen rotation or upon recreating the screen.

        Note that setting a clipping rectangle will also reset the SupportMapFragment's viewing rectangle to its full default size.

        If the ViewRect is not valid, this method does nothing.

        Specified by:
        setClipRect in interface com.nokia.maps.MapUi
        Parameters:
        rect - A ViewRect for rendering MapObject objects and similar map-related screen elements
        transformCenter - A PointF representing the center coordinate for map transformations such as zooming and rotation
        See Also:
        SupportMapFragment.setClipRect(ViewRect)

      • setClipRect

        public void setClipRect(ViewRect rect)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets a clipping rectangle to this SupportMapFragment. Only the area specified by the ViewRect will be used for rendering, while the rest of the view will be masked in black. This rectangle will be reset to the full size of the SupportMapFragment upon screen rotation or upon recreating the screen.

        If the ViewRect is not valid, this method does nothing.

        Specified by:
        setClipRect in interface com.nokia.maps.MapUi
        Parameters:
        rect - A ViewRect for rendering MapObject objects and similar map-related screen elements
        See Also:
        SupportMapFragment.setClipRect(ViewRect, PointF)

      • getCopyrightBoundaryRect

        Deprecated. 
        Gets the current HERE copyright logo's boundary rectangle. Returns null if a boundary rect has not been set previously.
        Specified by:

        See Also:
        SupportMapFragment.setCopyrightBoundaryRect(Rect)

      • setCopyrightBoundaryRect

        public void setCopyrightBoundaryRect(android.graphics.Rect rect)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets a rectangle, in pixels, relative to the top left corner of the SupportMapFragment's boundary, for the placement of the HERE copyright logo.

        If the specified rectangle is not contained completely within the current visible map area, their area of intersection will be used instead of the specified rectangle's area. The copyright logo and copyright margin must fit into the rectangle, otherwise specified rectangle will be ignored.

        The rectangle is reset upon screen rotation or upon screen re-creation, or it can be done by setting a null-Rect.

        Specified by:
        setCopyrightBoundaryRect in interface com.nokia.maps.MapUi
        Parameters:
        rect - A Rect representing the desired rectangular container to be used for positioning the copyright logo. Use null Rect to reset the boundary container.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Rect supplied is invalid

      • getCopyrightMargin

        public int getCopyrightMargin()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the current margin for the HERE copyright logo, in number of pixels, as an offset from the edge of the visible map area to the edge of the logo.

        This method only returns a valid value once fragment initialization has taken place.

        Specified by:
        getCopyrightMargin in interface com.nokia.maps.MapUi
        Returns:
        The current offset from the edge of the SupportMapFragment, in number of pixels

      • setCopyrightLogoPosition

        public void setCopyrightLogoPosition(CopyrightLogoPosition position)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets a position for the HERE copyright logo. The current default is to place the logo at the center-bottom of the visible map view area.

        After the logo's position is set, the position stays effective even when the screen is rotated or re-created.

        Specified by:
        setCopyrightLogoPosition in interface com.nokia.maps.MapUi
        Parameters:
        position - A CopyrightLogoPosition value representing the desired placement of the HERE copyright logo with respect to the visible map view area

      • getScreenCapture

        public void getScreenCapture(OnScreenCaptureListener listener)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the full screen bitmap for the SupportMapFragment. This method is asynchronous and will invoke a callback once the operation is completed through the OnScreenCaptureListener. The SupportMapFragment must be visible to create the screen capture.
        Parameters:
        listener - A OnScreenCaptureListener to listen for the callback when screen capture is complete.
